content:
I just heard about PyCurator: https://github.com/michaelbaluja/PyCurator

via Amber at https://groups.google.com/g/dataverse-community/c/JI8HPgGarr8/m/N2kCL-ESAQAJ

"And there could be a Machine Learning metadata block added to support descriptions of "number of instances", "task type", and other technical details (according to Stephanie's presentation). Also, they created this neat tool for automating the API metadata searching across all these repositories, it's called PyCurator (may have heard?) that helps with routine metadata API calls to get metadata from existing repositories (including Dataverses, and others!)"
